featured.text: If we go north or south, we won’t notice any difference, because there is usually no time zone change.
In the early 1990s, however, scientists noticed that synesthetic colors do not change over time.
“But,” says Jack, “most people don’t take any notice of the doctor’s advice!” 44.
As they moved from one table to another, they noticed new ideas emerging from the discussions.

other.text: The researchers noticed that small drops of water on the wheat leaves would move to combine and form a larger drop.
From the statement “But … most people don’t take any notice of the doctor's advice!”
Later, as steel wire became more common, inventors began to notice its elastic feature.

definition.en_def: A written or spoken announcement or warning.
definition.example: I received a notice about the upcoming meeting.
